Articles.Content:
-In this challenge you will get a spacecraft into mun orbit into the lowest orbit possible

-HyperEdit and Mehcjeb not allowed, everything else is

-Need Proof(s) (screenshots/video)

-Have Fun!
Your attempt? Also you said nothing about the debug menu, so I can use infinite fuel.

I remember I got into a near perfect equatorial orbit, as circular as I could get, meaning there would be very little (if any) latitudinal variation. With this, I passed the surface at essentially the same location and altitude each orbit, which was around under 50m from the surface, as I recall. I do not have existing proof of this however, as that was some time ago.

> 
> Your attempt? Also you said nothing about the debug menu, so I can use infinite fuel.

The debug menu is allowed

WOH! DONE! AWSOME! managed to get to a successful orbit on my 4th attempt twice i got so low i crashed, once i ran out of fuel, then monopropellant then elctrisity then crashed but my fourth well i succeed!

![t4CPT#0](http://imgur.com/a/t4CPT#0)

Plz tell me if these images load? as they don't for me, just a icon.

if not then - [imgur.com/a/t4CPT#0](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/imgur.com/a/t4CPT)
The real challenge would *then* be construct an arch and have your craft pass *underneath* the arch with each orbit!

.
